case_vignette: A 2-day-old female is noted to have a rash all over the body and distorted feet at birth. A 24 week ultrasound was remarkable for bilateral shortening of the long bones. Physical examination demonstrates light, fine yellow scales along curvilinear distribution on the chest, bilateral upper and lower extremities on background diffuse erythema. The bilateral feet are turned inward with plantar aspect almost sideways. An X-ray of the knees demonstrate focal dot-like calcifications in the epiphyses. The patient is diagnosed with a rare genetic disorder known as **Epidermolysis Bullosa**. The patient is also diagnosed with **Congenital Talipes Equinovarus** (clubfoot) and **Osteogenesis Imperfecta**. The patient is also diagnosed with **Congenital Talipes Equinovarus** (clubfoot) and **Osteogenesis Imperfecta**. I have a rash all over my body and my feet are turned inward.
